results.abstract: Space shuttle Discovery, already delayed three times, is grounded again by NASA because of potentially dangerous hydrogen leak (M)

headline.main: NASA Delays Shuttle Launching After Finding Hydrogen Leak and Crack

results.snippet: It was the fourth time the shuttle was grounded on what was to be its final flight.
results.lead_paragraph: KENNEDY SPACE CENTER, Fla. -- The shuttle Discovery, already delayed three times by technical problems and bad weather, was grounded again Friday, this time by a potentially dangerous gaseous hydrogen leak in a vent line attached to the ship's external tank. The Discovery was initially scheduled to make its 39th and final flight last Monday, bearing fresh supplies and an intelligent robot for the International Space Station. But complications delayed the flight from Monday to Friday, when the hydrogen leak led NASA to conclude that the shuttle would not be ready to launch before its flight window closed this Monday.

results.abstract: On the Run blog profiles Jon Mendes, 90-year-old former bomber pilot and investment banker who is preparing to run in his 12th New York City Marathon; photos (M)

headline.main: After 90 Vivacious Years, What's Another Marathon?

results.snippet: Upon completing the New York City Marathon on Sunday, Jon Mendes would become the ninth-oldest finisher in the race’s history, but he has a bigger goal for 2014.
results.lead_paragraph: Four days beyond his 90th birthday, it might be enough for Jon Mendes to celebrate having the original parts and warranty on his knees and hips. Instead, he is running -- well, O.K., walking -- the New York City Marathon on Sunday, having procured his racing essentials: petroleum jelly to keep his feet and thighs from chafing, adhesive bandages to prevent his nipples from bleeding and a finish-line beverage that is not strictly considered a sports drink.

results.abstract: Jon Mendes of Manhattan, who walked the New York City Marathon on Sunday four days after his 90th birthday, completed the 26.2-mile course in nine-plus hours.

headline.main: Mendes Crosses Finish Line of 5-Borough Trek

results.snippet: Jon Mendes of Manhattan, who walked the New York City Marathon on Sunday four days after his 90th birthday, completed the 26.2-mile course in nine-plus hours.
results.lead_paragraph: Jon Mendes of Manhattan, who walked the New York City Marathon on Sunday four days after his 90th birthday, crossed the finish line of the 26.2-mile course after nine-plus hours.

results.snippet: 3:50 P.M. (Sundance) NO ONE KNOWS ABOUT PERSIAN CATS  (2009) Negar (Negar Shaghaghi) and Ashkan (Ashkan Koshanejad) are young musicians with dreams of touring Europe and a need for backup players for their indie rock band -- in Tehran. ''Of course...
results.lead_paragraph: 3:50 P.M. (Sundance) NO ONE KNOWS ABOUT PERSIAN CATS (2009) Negar (Negar Shaghaghi) and Ashkan (Ashkan Koshanejad) are young musicians with dreams of touring Europe and a need for backup players for their indie rock band -- in Tehran. ''Of course circumstances for iconoclastic, bohemian young people in Iran are not what they are elsewhere,'' A. O. Scott wrote in his review in The New York Times, adding that ''both the pathos and the buoyant energy'' of this ''bouncy, seething'' film by Bahman Ghobadi ''come from the sense that Negar, Ashkan and their friends are bravely laying claim to creativity, idealism and free expression in defiance of an authoritarian state that seeks to deny them those universal birthrights of modern youth.'' The film, above, which won a jury award in Cannes, is one of several movies that prompted the Iranian government to announce that it would punish filmmakers who do not obtain approval for their work. ''Productions in Iran are subject to review before being released there,'' The Times reported in December 2009, ''and directors are expected to submit screenplays for approval before beginning shooting, though some ignore the process.'' 8 P.M. (National Geographic) DOG WHISPERER Sunita L. Williams and Leland Melvin met in a NASA astronaut class in 1998 and have each journeyed to the International Space Station. But back on Earth they spend a lot of time trying to manage their problem dogs. Ms. Williams's Jack Russell terrier, Gorby, likes to pick on dogs bigger than he is. Mr. Leland's Rhodesian Ridgeback mix Jake will try to bite anyone who gets near his owner. Cesar Millan comes to the rescue. In ''Squid vs. Whale,'' at 9, marine biologists attach a remote camera to a sperm whale, the largest toothed predator on the planet, as it journeys 1,000 feet below the ocean's surface in the Gulf of California in search of its favorite meal, the colossal squid.

results.snippet: 9 P.M. (13, 49) LENNON NAKED Christopher Eccleston (''Doctor Who''), above, summons the spirit of John Lennon and Naoko Mori (''Torchwood'') is Yoko Ono in this ''Masterpiece Contemporary'' drama commemorating the 30th anniversary of Lennon's death...
results.lead_paragraph: 9 P.M. (13, 49) LENNON NAKED Christopher Eccleston (''Doctor Who''), above, summons the spirit of John Lennon and Naoko Mori (''Torchwood'') is Yoko Ono in this ''Masterpiece Contemporary'' drama commemorating the 30th anniversary of Lennon's death on Dec. 8, 1980. Robert Jones wrote the script and Edmund Coulthard directed the production, which recreates scenes in Lennon's life from 1964 to 1971: the time his separated parents forced him to choose between them; his encounters with his absentee father (Christopher Fairbank); his arguments with Paul McCartney (Andrew Scott); the death of Brian Epstein (Rory Kinnear), the Beatles' manager, from a drug overdose in 1967; Ms. Ono's role in the breakup of the band; and the couple's subsequent self-imposed exile in New York City. 9 A.M. (CNN) STATE OF THE UNION WITH CANDY CROWLEY In interviews here and on ''This Week With Christiane Amanpour,'' at 10 on ABC, Adm. Mike Mullen, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, speaks about President Obama's Afghanistan war strategy; the discussion of that strategy by NATO leaders this weekend in Lisbon; and whether Afghan security forces will be ready to take control of their country by 2014. He also discusses the effect on national security of the stalled ratification of the Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty.

headline.main: Auburn Is Seeing Crimson Over Questions and Rivalry

results.snippet: The most anticipated day of every year in the state of Alabama has arrived with Auburn football devotees caught in a riptide of emotions.     The Tigers have knocked down their previous 11 obstacles on the schedule and are a consensus No. 2 in the...
results.lead_paragraph: The most anticipated day of every year in the state of Alabama has arrived with Auburn football devotees caught in a riptide of emotions. The Tigers have knocked down their previous 11 obstacles on the schedule and are a consensus No. 2 in the rankings. They can rest assured that Alabama, which hosts Friday's game in Tuscaloosa, will not add to its vast collection of national title trophies.

results.abstract: Bruce Gierson article profiles Olga Kotelko, 91-year-old athlete who scientists are studying to test theories about how exercise slows down the aging process; photos; charts (L)
results.snippet: Olga Kotelko, 91, is shattering track-and-field records — in her age group — and testing theories about aging.
results.lead_paragraph: On the third floor of the Montreal Chest Institute, at McGill University, Olga Kotelko stood before a treadmill in the center of a stuffy room that was filling up with people who had come just for her. They were there to run physical tests, or to extract blood from her earlobe, or just to observe and take notes. Kotelko removed her glasses. She wore white New Balance sneakers and black running tights, and over her silver hair, a plastic crown that held in place a breathing tube. Tanja Taivassalo, a 40-year-old muscle physiologist, adjusted the fit of Kotelko's stretch-vest. It was wired with electrodes to measure changes in cardiac output -- a gauge of the power of her heart. Taivassalo first met Kotelko at last year's world outdoor masters track championships in Lahti, Finland, the pinnacle of the competitive season for older tracksters. Taivassalo went to watch her dad compete in the marathon. But she could hardly fail to notice the 91-year-old Canadian, bespandexed and elfin, who was knocking off world record after world record.
